topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5599b61e63687221d40001ad#post_5599b61e63687221d40001ad
It's why IQ tests are bullshit as well.  IQ tests assume you're intelligent at *EVERYTHING*.

People that say "I'm a expert at everything" are fucking morons if you ask me.  Making a test that assumes in order to be intelligent you have to be smart at everything is stupid.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5599b6ac6368724bbe00007f#post_5599b6ac6368724bbe00007f

Online, absolutely.

However, like everything in life, there's an exception. IQ tests tend not to be used to measure how smart you are at everything, but more, the aptitudes that your brain developed up to the point you're at the time and see if there's a major drawback in an area that's obstructing your development in some task/activity or vice versa, that you developed a skill beyond the norm, in which case, could be something to get focused on to give you a higher advantage on that field.

"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5599b7976368724bbe0001c6#post_5599b7976368724bbe0001c6

Jacques!

"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5599b7da6368726901000c91#post_5599b7da6368726901000c91
If you ever want to know what I really suck at I suck at vocabulary of languages and memorization of specifics.  I literally have the vocabulary size of a sixth grader, but I can figure out what a word means by it's sentence structure.  That's why I can read spanish without knowing spanish or such cause even though I don't know spanish I can tell what it says.

The way to defeat me is to have a vocabulary quiz.
